text:
WHEN the Lord turned again the captívity of Síon,
then were we like unto thém that dreám. 2 Then was our mouth fílled with laúghter,
and our tóngue with jóy. 3 Then said they amóng the heáthen,
The Lord hath done great thíngs for thém. 4 Yea, the Lord hath done great things for ús alreády;
whéreof we rejóice. 5 Turn our captívity, O Lórd,
as the rívers in the soúth. 6 They that sów in teárs
shall réap in jóy. 7 He that now goeth on his way weeping,† and beareth fórth good seéd,
shall doubtless come again with joy, and bríng his sheáves with him. 8 Glory be to the Father, and tó the Són,
and to the Hóly Ghóst; 9 As it was in the beginning, † is now, and éver sháll be,
world wíthout énd. Amen.
